alert.note: Alert for Door; Florence; Forest; Langlade; Menominee; Northern Marinette County; Northern Oconto County; Shawano; Southern Marinette County; Southern Oconto County (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 4:33AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FOG GREATLY REDUCING THE VISIBILITY ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST WISCONSIN... Light winds, moisture from melting snow, and clear skies earlier in the night allowed fog to form over the northeast corner of Wisconsin. The fog was mainly located from the Green Bay metro area west to Shawano and north to Iron Mountain, Michigan. The fog was reducing the visibility to less than 1/4 mile in places, resulting in hazardous travel conditions. Sub-freezing temperatures are also favorable for the deposition of frost on untreated pavement, which can lead to icy and very slippery conditions. If you are traveling across northeast Wisconsin early this morning, be sure to use your use your low-beam headlights and maintain plenty of distance between your vehicle and other vehicles. Allow extra time to reach your destination and drive at a speed that will allow you to safely stop if you unexpectedly encounter an object or animal on the road. Also remain alert for the possibility of encountering icy patches of pavement with very poor traction. The fog should begin to dissipate an hour or two after daybreak. Warming temperatures by mid-morning will also melt any frost or resulting ice on the roads.
